title: Renee Zellweger kicks off Judy's awards hopes with BIFA nominations
text:
Share this article via flipboard

Share this article via email

Share this article via messenger

Renee Zellweger has received acclaim for her work as Judy Garland (Picture: Pathe)

Renee Zellweger has kicked off the 2019/2020 awards season with a best actress nomination at the 2010 British Independent Film Awards.

The actress, who received wide acclaim for her role as Judy Garland in the movie Judy, is expected to pick up major gongs in the coming months and remains the current frontrunner for a Bafta and Oscar.

However at the BIFAs she has strong competition from Jessie Buckley, who won the 2018 best newcomer award.

Holliday Grainger, Sally Hawkins and Vicky Knight are all also nominated.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Dev Patel is nominated for best actor for his work in The Personal History Of David Copperfield which leads with 11 nominations.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Dev’s co-stars Tilda Swinton and Hugh Laurie will both compete in their respective supporting categories.

Dev Patel stars in a colour-blind cast of The Personal History Of David Copperfield (Picture: Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures)

Netflix’s Marriage Story and Bong Joon-ho’s Parasite are both up for best international independent film.

Tilda Swinton’s daughter Honor Swinton Byrne is up for best newcomer for her work in The Souvenir.
